1.name: Full Stack Development | The Loomis Chaffee School
1.description: Created a full stack application with a for the Deansâ€™ Office at Loomis Chafee that assigns students into dorms (a process that usually took 3+ weeks over summer) based on student survey through the Genetic Algorithm and Linear Programming. The software is currently in use by the deans.

2.name: Research Intern | UCSC (Science Internship Program)
2.description: Worked on researching novel contexts to apply the WaveFunctionCollapse Algorihtm. Specifically, I analyzed the algorithm's ability to generate text from patters, applying conventional NLG strategies and comparing against state-of-the-art NLG architectures.

3.name: Full Stack Development | The Loomis Chaffee School
3.description: Created a web-app for Loomis Chaffee's Chemistry department (accesible to Loomis students enrolled in any Chemistry course) that allows users to visuallize molecules in 2D/3D and compare with gemoetries predicted by VSEPR theory. The software is currently in use by the school.

4.name: Software Development Intern | Carnegie Mellon University / RIT
4.description: Created a web system to easily access data obtained during the lab's studies of primates.

5.name: Software Development Intern | Samsung Cheil
5.description: Created a dashboard for marketers to see and compare available public billboards for advertising purposes. Researched the needs and requirements of the marketers and provided integration with backend database
